title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #737**

Let G have chromatic number ℵ₁. Must there exist an edge e in cycles of all large lengths?

**Status:** SOLVED (Thomassen 1983)
mathContext: Connects uncountable chromatic number to cycle structure in infinite graphs.

title: Chromatic Number
content:
**chromaticNumber G:**

The minimum number of colors needed to properly color the vertices of G.

For infinite graphs, this can be an infinite cardinal.
mathContext: De Bruijn-Erdős: χ(G) = sup{χ(H) : H finite subgraph}.

title: Chromatic Number ℵ₁
content:
**hasChromaticNumberAleph1 G:**

χ(G) = ℵ₁ (the first uncountable cardinal).

This is the critical threshold for Thomassen's result.
mathContext: ℵ₁ is the cardinality of the set of countable ordinals.

title: Cycle of Length n
content:
**hasCycleOfLength G n:**

G contains a cycle of length n.

A cycle is a closed walk with distinct vertices.

title: Edge in Cycle
content:
**edgeInCycleOfLength G e n:**

The edge e belongs to some cycle of length n in G.

This is the key property studied in the problem.

title: Edge in All Large Cycles
content:
**edgeInAllLargeCycles G e N:**

∀n ≥ N, the edge e is in a cycle of length n.

The edge is a "universal" edge for large cycles.

title: Existence Property
content:
**existsEdgeInAllLargeCycles G:**

∃e, ∃N, ∀n ≥ N: e is in a cycle of length n.

This is the main property asked about in the problem.

title: Erdős-Hajnal-Shelah (1974)
content:
**erdos_hajnal_shelah_1974:**

If χ(G) = ℵ₁, then G contains all sufficiently large cycles.

∃N, ∀n ≥ N: G has a cycle of length n.

This established cycle existence but not the edge property.

title: Thomassen's Theorem (1983)
content:
**thomassen_1983:**

If χ(G) = ℵ₁, then there exists an edge e such that G contains a cycle of length n through e, for all large n.

This is STRONGER than EHS - cycles can be routed through one edge.

title: Problem Resolved
content:
**erdos_737_resolved:**

Thomassen's theorem directly resolves Problem #737 affirmatively.

The edge e exists.

title: Finite χ Insufficient
content:
**finite_chromatic_no_cycles:**

Finite chromatic number doesn't guarantee any cycles.

Example: Trees have χ = 2 but no cycles.

title: ℵ₁ is Threshold
content:
**aleph1_is_threshold:**

ℵ₁ is the critical value for the strong cycle property.

Smaller chromatic numbers don't give Thomassen's conclusion.

title: Pancyclic
content:
**isPancyclic G:**

∀n ≥ 3: G contains a cycle of length n.

Graphs with χ = ℵ₁ are "eventually pancyclic" by EHS.

title: Routing Property
content:
**routing_through_edge:**

All large cycles can be routed through a single edge.

This follows from Thomassen's theorem.

title: Universal Cycle Edge
content:
**isUniversalCycleEdge e:**

An edge e is "universal" if it's in cycles of all large lengths.

Thomassen proves such edges exist when χ = ℵ₁.

title: Summary Theorem
content:
**erdos_737_summary:**

Combines all components: For χ(G) = ℵ₁, there exists an edge in all large cycles.

Thomassen's theorem as the main result.

title: Problem Solved
content:
**erdos_737_solved:**

Erdős Problem #737 was completely resolved by Thomassen in 1983.
